question: what is JavaScript

options.a: An object-oriented computer programming language commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.
options.b: An open-source server-side scripting language that many devs use for web development.
options.c: A simple design language intended to simplify the process of making web pages presentable.
options.d: A strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

answer: An object-oriented computer programming language commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.
